sermons.title: God's Burden for Zion
sermons.description: A powerful message by Brother Warnock showing us clearly how we are a holy priesthood raised up by Jesus Christ as our high priest. And he shows how the gospel needs not just to be told but shown in the life of us the body of Christ. The world has yet to feel the true impact of the life of the gospel.
sermons.preacher_description:
George Warnock (1917 - 2016)
Listen to freely downloadable audio sermons by the speaker George Warnock in mp3 format. Brother George Warnock was used of the Lord in the latter rain movement which he had influence in. He wrote some books which were corrections to imbalances in his day. His well known book was: "The Feast Of Tabernacles"
His heart has been to serve the body of Christ and see a last days manifestation of a pure Church that Jesus Christ will redeem as His bride. He tentmaked as a carpenter until well into retirement. He resided in Cranbrook, BC, Canada until his death. You can read a expanded biography of him on his family website.

sermons.title: Going Up To Zion
sermons.description: An examination of the Hebraic distinctive of the faith of Israel, lost to Jews presently, but soon to be restored at the end of the age that they may bless all the nations.
sermons.preacher_description:
Art Katz (1929 â€“ 2007)
Listen to freely downloadable audio sermons by the speaker Art Katz in mp3 format. He was radically converted by reading the New Testament. God used him to have a powerful prophetic insight into the end-times and the coming suffering of the jewish people before the great accepting of Jesus as Messiah. His eschatological insight is a very needful truth to be realized in the body of Christ. 

Art was a prophetic voice insofar as he called his listeners to purposes in God that would affect both time and eternity, purposes that had to do with the glory of God in the Church.   Frequently, his messages called the Church to an awareness of the Last Days [End-times] in such a way that made that time seem imminent and at the door.

sermons.title: Rome or Zion?
sermons.description: There is a corrective needed in the Church at large – especially in the churches that believe they “have it together.”  A message spoken at a predominantly Catholic charismatic conference, and was a call to a reality beyond the Church’s own self-absorption and into the purpose and context of God in the Last Days.

sermons.title: The Controversy of Zion
sermons.description: This message was delivered on 07/11/1969 at the Atlantic States Christian Convocation (Wabanna) 1969.
sermons.preacher_description:
T. Austin Sparks (1888 â€“ 1971)
Listen to freely downloadable audio sermons by the speaker T. Austin Sparks in mp3 format. He was ordained as a Baptist pastor at the age of 24, and from 1912 to 1926 led three congregations in Greater London. During these years, he was also closely related to Jessie Penn-Lewis and her publication and speaking ministry, the "Overcomer Testimony."

Among the many books that he wrote, at least three are regarded as Christian classics: The School of Christ, The Centrality and Supremacy of the Lord Jesus Christ and We Beheld His Glory. The primary theme of Sparks' books is the exaltation of the Lord Jesus Christ. He mentored Watchman Nee for many years and was very influential in his understanding of the Church Life.

sermons.title: The Liberation of Zion
sermons.preacher_description:
David Wilkerson (1931 – 2011)
Listen to freely downloadable audio sermons by the speaker David Wilkerson in mp3 format. Founder of Times Square Church in New York City with over 100 different languages spoken in the congregation. Wilkerson wrote many powerful books such as: The Vision and Cross and the Switchblade. His ministry was prophetic as God called him to be a watchman to the Church in North America. He gave clear messages on repentance to the Church. 

Wilkerson also founded Teen Challenge where there are hundreds of centres for Christ-centered drug recovery and addiction recovery. He also organized and spoke at pastors gatherings in many countries where he gave prophetic strong messages to encourage pastors and leaders.

sermons.title: Ye Are Come To Zion - Part 1
sermons.description: Part 1 of 8. This highly recommended series deals with entering the rest of Christ and with coming into the full purpose of God for our lives so that the life of Christ may flow to those around us. We are come to Zion, to all the provision we need to live a life like that. We begin here where the history of man begins, in the Garden. Mr. Sparks shows us that Christ is our garden, our resting place, our heritage.

sermons.description: Part 2 of 8. Here we continue on the theme of entering into God's rest, entering into something that God has purposed and perfected in Christ. Entering God's rest doesn't mean we do nothing. So then what are we going to do?

sermons.description: Part 3 of 8. In continuation of our theme of our heritage that is Christ, we deal with where and how we can find the Lord.  How can we be in touch with Him? He would have us be occupied with what occupies Him.

sermons.description: Part 4 of 8. The Cornerstone of Zion is Jesus Christ, and everything is built on and relates to the Cornerstone. This is a challenge to remain focused on this firm foundation and not on the institutions of religion that man has built.

sermons.title: Ye Are Come To Zion - Part 5
sermons.description: Part 5 of 8. Contrasting Jacob and Zion, here we are shown that Zion is a place of praise, rejoicing, and singing. God delights in mercy but He delights even more in inhabiting the praises of His people. Mr. Sparks takes us on a trip from the wilderness to a place of glory.

sermons.description: Part 6 of 8. Here we deal with the controversy of Zion and Jerusalem. Just as there is always great controversy over Jerusalem here on earth, there is great controversy over Zion in the heavenly places.

With that new life comes a divine meaning and purpose to our lives, a sense of destiny! Life in the Spirit brings an understanding of this calling.

sermons.title: Ye Are Come To Zion - Part 8
sermons.description: Part 8 of 8. God will not take rest until righteousness goes forth, for Zion's sake. The Lord's wants a people who share this tremendous concern for this vessel in the earth, this Zion, that expresses His righteousness and glory to the universe. He wants a fire burning in the earth for all nations to see. We must be consumed with this same burden.
